بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم
من عبد اللّه
عند عند
أعلم السّيّد الأجل وفّقه اللّه توفيق العارفين وجعل له كرائم الصّالحين محمّد وآله
إجمعين وسوا ذلك أنّي مشتاق إليك كثير ليس قليل واللّه لنا
الاجتماع ويا مولاي طحــنــت قليل دقيق وما يباعويهپپپعونه عشر دراهم
الّذي أخذتم فأرسلهم لي مع الطّيب وإن كان ما أخذت شي
وطلّعته للقاضي ولا تتّهم عنّي وإن كان ما احَدپ شي
أرسل أعلمني أكري ذا ذا سلع وإن كان أخذت البعض
أرسل لي وأعلمني فما تحتاج وصّيه وصيّة فما يعونني
إلّا الدّراهم وسلّم لي على الأخ عبد الرّحيم وعلى الأخ عيسى
وسلّم لي على الشّيخ أبو مفرّج وتعلم المكين إن كان ما دفع لك
شي تعلم تقلّه أنا أرسل إليه كتاب لكرى دابّة ويطلع فهو
أرسل مالي لي ما يعونني إلّا الدّراهم لأنّي أريد أكري بهم
والسّلام عليكم نصر اللّه في علمه
ولا تصرف لي ذهب واشترها دراهم فإن الصّرف
في قنا وقوص سبعة وثلاثين واليوسفي والتّوفيقيّ تسعة بتسعة عشــر
درهم وربع اليوسفي واللّه اللّه سيّرهم لي دراهم
فهم للكرا والسّلام عليك ورحمة اللّه وبركاته
إلى ساحل القصــيــر يسلّم للأخ نجيب مولا عبد اللّه فخرهم
إلى شونة أبو مفرّج عليه ø الــسّلام بلّغ بنصــر تؤجر اللّه ø

In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate.
From ʿAbd Allāh.
I write to inform the most noble master - may God make him as successful as those who have acquired Divine Knowledge, and make him among the choicest of the virtuous men: the Prophet Muḥammad and his entire
family - and now to the main topic: I miss you terribly, not just a little bit, but a lot! O God, [I hope] we can be family - and now to the main topic: I miss you terribly, not just a little bit, but a lot! O God, I hope we would be
reunited [soon]. O my master! I have ground a small amount of flour and [other foodstuffs] that are worth ten dirhams. reunited soon. O my master! I have ground a small amount of flour and [other foodstuffs] that are worth ten dirhams,
Please send me what you have received (i.e. money) along with the perfume. If you have not received any [money?], which you have received. Please send them (i.e., the ten dirhams) to me, along with the perfume. If you have not received any [money],
... If you have not received any [money], then you should bring up the matter to the judge. Don't blame me, though. If you have not received any [money],
send me a notification, so I will lease [riding animals] to carry the goods. If you have received some [of the money], send me a notification, so I will rent [riding animals] to carry the goods. If you have received some [of the money],
send me a notification, too. Whatever you need, order it [from me]. I need nothing but
cash. ... [cash in] dirhams. My regards to Brother ʿAbd al-Raḥīm and Brother ʿĪsā.
My regards to Shaykh Abū Mufarrij. Please tell al-Makīn - if he has not paid you ... Please tell al-Makīn - if he has not paid
anything yet - that I will send him a letter about leasing riding animals and that he will get [the goods?]. He is the one who anything yet - that I will send him a letter about renting riding animals (li-kirā dābba) and that he will get [the goods]. ...
ought to send me money. I need nothing but cash, because I intend to use it to lease [riding animals].
Peace be upon you. May God help [you] in regard to His Divine Knowledge.
Do not pay me golden [dinars]; change them to silver dirhams. The exchange rate
in Qinā and Qūṣ is thirty-seven [dirhams per dinar], and [if it is] the Yūsufī (? or Tawfīqī) [dirham], then it is nineteen
and a quarter dirhams [per dinar]. O God, O God! send me the cash in silver dirhams [only]!
It is for leasing [riding animals]. Peace be upon you. God's mercy and blessings.
To the shore of Quseir, to the care of Brother Najīb, the associate of ʿAbd Allāh Fakhruhum.
to the warehouse of Abū Mufarrij. Peace. May God help all!
